item.title: How to run a world-class economics department
item.description: Benchmarking data shows central banks have myriad ways of organising their economists. So how do some of the world’s top research organisations do it?

item.title: RBA sets up new panel of private-sector economists
item.description: Expert panel will meet at least twice a year; move follows “embarrassing” forecasting issues

item.title: El Salvador abolishes statistics agency
item.description: Central bank will absorb body that calculates inflation

item.title: IMF warns Iceland over bank privatisation and housing market
item.description: Some bank investors have conflicts of interest and housing market is overheating – report

item.title: Swiss central bank defends board structure
item.description: Think-tank suggested governing board was “susceptible to group think” in April report

item.title: What is the right size for a central bank board?
item.description: There is greater consensus for smaller boards in theory than in practice

item.title: IMF urges Kosovo to fill vital central bank positions
item.description: Supervisory board lacked quorum for approximately 18 months

item.title: Leading Colombian presidential candidate plans central bank reform
item.description: Gustavo Petro claims current government has captured the board of directors

item.title: Bank of Canada carries on as truckers protest
item.description: Non-essential staff working from home as anti-vaccine demonstrators occupy Canada’s capital

item.title: Union objects to Colombian central bank’s branch closures
item.description: Bank of the Republic is converting some regional offices to cultural centres, closing treasuries

item.title: Pakistan passes central bank autonomy law
item.description: Senate approval brings country closer to meeting IMF loan requirements

item.title: Podcast: Dominik Weh on why central banks need to embrace technology
item.description: Central banks need to keep abreast of the current technology or risk being left behind

item.title: Bank of Mexico creates environmental and social risk department
item.description: Central bank’s attitude to environmental risk might put it at odds with government, says commentator

item.title: RBA to invest in solar panels for refurbished head office
Angola’s central bank reopens office after delays
item.description: Branch was reportedly completed in 2017 but has lain dormant following governor dismissal

item.title: Bank of Ghana wins legal case against ‘corrupt’ firm
item.description: Central bank says it uncovered bribery and a corrupt tender process during investigation

item.title: FCA mulls removing decision-making powers from senior committee
item.description: Decisions regarding firms failing to meet FCA standards would be taken by FCA staff instead

item.title: Minority groups sidelined by BoE, report finds
item.description: Internal review reveals minority ethnic staff felt less safe in the workplace, while career progression was stifled

item.title: FCA to expand UK footprint as part of new strategy
item.description: Regulator’s priorities will include climate risk disclosures and financial sector diversity

item.title: Climate training hub launched by international consortium
item.description: BIS training platform will act as single access point for climate risk training for central banks

item.title: BoE adapting working practices to post-Covid world, says Place
item.description: Central bank is changing staffing, technology and buildings in light of lessons from pandemic working

item.title: Sarb celebrates centenary with virtual ceremony
item.description: Tributes were paid by former governors, regional central bank representatives and the heads of the IMF and BIS

item.title: MAS’s Vincent Loy and Celine Sia on transforming data management
item.description: The assistant managing directors explain how uniting business and technology functions is opening up new possibilities for data collection, governance and analytics

item.title: The evolving ‘strategy function’ in central banks
item.description: Some institutions participating in a survey of 27 central banks still struggle to fully harness an effective ‘strategy function’, according to the ECB’s Jean-Charles Sevet and Alejandro de la Cuesta

item.title: Black people in finance face ‘insidious’ racism – FCA official
item.description: Sheldon Mills says only 10% of senior figures at UK’s FTSE 100 firms are from ethnic minorities

item.title: BoE to close cash distribution centre in 2023
item.description: Cash operations will continue at Debden site while BoE reviews geographical footprint

item.title: Central Bank of Barbados closes office after volcano erupts
item.description: Ash cloud from neighbouring island causes central bank to suspend in-person operations

item.title: Central Bank of the UAE prepares to gain insurance powers
item.description: Insurance Authority is being merged into CBUAE as part of bid to become “top 10” central bank

item.title: RBI’s training college for supervisors goes fully operational
item.description: Governor aims to build class of professional supervisors, as Indian banking sector remains fragile

item.title: Central bank social media usage continues to evolve
item.description: User growth among central banks has started to level off, but those that use social media platforms are seeing growing subscriber bases and an increase in engagement

item.title: Fed joining NGFS would be a ‘game changer’ – Després
item.description: NGFS to increase study of monetary policy’s climate implications, head of secretariat says

item.title: Belize’s central bank must improve cyber regulation – IMF staff
item.description: IMF staff warns central bank must upgrade physical resilience in face of hurricane threat

item.title: ECB taking further steps to address gender imbalance - Isabel Schnabel
item.description: Efforts to foster greater inclusion of women help tackle “groupthink”, says board member

item.title: World Economic Forum postponed due to Covid-19
item.description: Health experts advised meeting would not be safe to take place in early 2021, spokesman says

item.title: Computing platforms for big data and AI
item.description: Implementing big-data and high-performance computing platforms is critical to support machine learning applications. Rafael Schmidt and Bruno Tissot offer insights on developing a comprehensive information strategy

item.title: Minutes highlight scale of BoE’s Covid-19 redeployment
item.description: Some staff were overwhelmed with work while others had little to do

item.title: Book notes: Central banking before 1800, by Ulrich Bindseil
item.description: A new standard reference point for the history of central banking

item.title: RBNZ’s Sam Allen on embracing the cloud
item.description: Central bank took a calculated risk in moving its financial markets group to a cloud platform

item.title: BoE moves to renewable energy
item.description: Bank of England says it has already beaten its 2016 target for carbon dioxide reduction

item.title: UK government struggled to attract female applicants for BoE governorship
item.description: Letter reveals only two of 23 applicants for Carney’s job were women, despite recruitment firm priding itself on ability to deliver a diverse candidate pool

item.title: BoE seeks partner to build public cloud environment
item.description: Central bank prepares for “step change” in IT infrastructure

item.title: Proportion of women working in central banks dips
item.description: On average, women make up 45% of central bank workforce, but improvements have been made to senior management make-up

item.title: Central Bank of Iceland completes merger with regulator
item.description: Governor Ásgeir Jónsson to retain overall responsibility; two new deputy positions created

item.title: BoE should improve governance around research, review finds
item.description: Research has improved but some issues remain, Independent Evaluation Office says

item.title: Overhaul of RBA archive sees a third of records digitalised
item.description: Externally-facing archive will give public greater insight into central bank’s history – review

item.title: IMF issues warning on Kazakh supervisory overhaul
item.description: Authorities should be careful not to undermine the supervisory capacity, staff say

item.title: Central banks report sharp improvement in data governance
item.description: Progress comes as many central banks complete projects to improve governance

item.title: BIS is strengthening ties with the Americas, says Carstens
item.description: Expanded role for regional office and potential innovation hub will bring closer ties, general manager says

item.title: The Deutsche Bundesbank’s digital transformation
item.description: The German central bank’s new digital agenda includes major re-engineering of legacy analytics, processes, innovation management and digital competency

item.title: RBI overhauling approach to risk management – annual report
item.description: Initiatives include improvements to enterprise risk management, risk tolerance and modelling
